channel.title: POLITICO Pulse
channel.description: Delivered daily by 10 a.m., Pulse examines the latest news in health care politics and policy.

item.title: Dr. Oz’s fraud-busting road show
item.description: Former famed television host and current CMS Administrator Mehmet Oz is back in the spotlight.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Trump’s drug-pricing hurdle
item.description: President Donald Trump is urging Congress to turn his most-favored-nation drug-pricing deals into law, but Republicans don’t seem too keen on codifying his deals with drugmakers.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Trump decries ‘crushing’ health costs, blames Dems
item.description: What President Donald Trump said about health care during the State of the Union.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: The state of health care
item.description: President Donald Trump’s State of the Union address tonight could offer a preview of how both parties are gearing up to battle over health care costs ahead of this year’s midterm elections.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Jay Bhattacharya: The man, the movie
item.description: Covid-19 contrarians in HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s orbit are seeking funding for a film poking fun at the federal response to the pandemic.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Mifepristone and the midterms
item.description: Anti-abortion groups want to see more from action Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s HHS on abortion pills — and they’re making it known.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: A Makary-Trump meeting
item.description: The FDA reversed course and decided to review Moderna’s seasonal flu vaccine application after a meeting between FDA Director Marty Makary and President Donald Trump, in which Trump expressed being less than thrilled with the agency’s handling of vaccine issues.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Health lobbying bonanza continues
item.description: Health care companies are mounting their defenses in Washington with more than two dozen lobbying registrations filed since Friday as the industry comes under scrutiny for its role in the high cost of care.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Taking stock of Kennedy’s first year
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Blue states prepare to lose federal health dollars
item.description: The Trump administration is trying to claw back around $660 million in grants that were earmarked for blue states.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: HHS’s side of the Moderna spat
item.description: The federal government on Wednesday told its side of the story amid a disagreement with Moderna after the FDA decided to refuse reviewing the drugmaker’s flu vaccine application.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: GOP senators: Speed up abortion pill review
item.description: FDA Commissioner Marty Makary fielded questions Tuesday from Republican senators in a closed-door briefing on the abortion pill mifepristone.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: From science lab to animal sanctuary?
item.description: The Trump administration got one step closer to its goal of reducing federally funded primate testing Monday.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Oura rings woo Washington
item.description: From the Pentagon to Capitol Hill, Oura rings are appearing on the fingers of some of the most powerful figures in Washington.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Up next in the affordability wars
item.description: Congress’ monthslong efforts to extend enhanced Affordable Care Act tax credits appear to be winding down.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Winding down animal testing
item.description: The Trump administration is advancing its efforts to wind down animal testing.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Kennedy’s vaccine-promise report card
item.description: It’s been a year since Senate HELP Chair Bill Cassidy (R-La.) announced he would support Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to be HHS secretary, despite his concerns about Kennedy’s longstanding anti-vaccine activism.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Will HHS be funded by the end of today?
item.description: The Department of Health and Human Services remains partially shut but could reopen imminently if the House can pass a spending package today, which Speaker Mike Johnson is pushing for.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Cassidy hits a MAHA wall
item.description: Cassidy’s recent tensions with Kennedy have further imperiled his prospects to a degree that his massive war chest and the power of incumbency may not be able to surmount.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Is HHS out of the woods?
item.description: President Donald Trump reached a deal with Democrats on Thursday to avoid a partial government shutdown — a move that makes it likely the Senate will pass a funding bill for HHS today.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: The subsidy saga continues
item.description: As Congress’ last-ditch attempt to extend enhanced Obamacare subsidies is underway, the impacts of tax credits’ expiration at the end of 2025 are becoming clearer.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Medicare Advantage: Big expectations, small raise
item.description: President Donald Trump largely spared insurers in his health plan, but the same can’t be said for his Medicare Advantage payment proposal.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Food policy vs. vaccine politics at the polls
item.description: Republicans are betting on an electoral boost from HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s Make America Healthy Again movement — especially around his healthy-food agenda.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: RFK Jr. adviser questions need for polio vaccine
item.description: The head of Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s panel of independent vaccine advisers recently questioned the necessity of the polio vaccine — spurring a sharp backlash.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Insurers’ day on the Hill
item.description: Republicans, Democrats and health insurance CEOs are at odds over who’s to blame for the rising cost of health care.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Can a bipartisan health deal pass?
item.description: Congressional leaders announced Tuesday that they had reached a bipartisan deal to address some aspects of the health care system.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: Health tech panel to reboot after a long break
item.description: A key federal advisory committee on advancing health tech is set to resume meetings after a yearlong pause.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper

item.title: US measles status in jeopardy
item.description: The U.S. could officially lose its measles elimination status in the coming months.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: ‘Resetting’ the GOP health care vision
item.description: President Donald Trump released his health care affordability plan Thursday — a sweeping blueprint pressuring Congress to cement many of his executive actions into law.
item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Kelly Hooper and Sophie Gardner

item.title: SAMHSA grants reinstated
item.description: The Department of Health and Human Services has reinstated nearly 3,000 substance use disorder and mental health services grants worth nearly $2 billion a day after terminating them.
item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Kelly Hooper
